items.title: How I earn $900,000 a year as a dermatologist

items.title: How I Built A $1M/Year Business - And Helped My Parents Retire

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Tuan Le vowed at 15 to help his parents retire after his family emigrated from Vietnam to Toronto in 2015, and a decade later his social video production company, ShortsCut, is generating over $1 million USD a year. He now pays his parents' rent and living expenses so they no longer have to work full time.
bullets: Tuan Le promised to help his parents retire after emigrating from Vietnam to Toronto in 2015.
He founded ShortsCut, a social video production company.
ShortsCut brings in over $1 million USD in annual sales as of 10 years after the vow.
Tuan now financially supports his parents' rent and living expenses so they can stop full-time work.
Video produced by CNBC Make It; published January 17, 2026.
takeaways: High-revenue potential exists within social video production companiesâ€”consider them as potential enterprise customers.

Success of small-to-medium production businesses can indicate steady demand for digital media capacityâ€”plan capacity and service levels accordingly.

items.title: AI w cenach transferowych â€“ jak wykorzystaÄ‡ jej potencjaÅ‚? | Monika Palmowska, Jakub Roszkiewicz

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ AI is already reshaping transfer pricing workstreamsâ€”supporting monitoring of profitability, comparative analyses and automation of documentation. KPMG experts note AI is likely to strengthen advisors rather than replace them, while flagging risks (data security, RODO, hallucinations) and practical implementation steps like process cleanup, ERP integration and using secure environments such as Digital Gateway.
bullets: AI use cases: rentability monitoring, benchmark analyses, and TP documentation automation.
AI augments tax advisors' work but does not replace professional judgement.
Key risks include data protection, security and AI hallucinations; compliance with RODO is highlighted.
Digital Gateway presented as a secure environment for AI work.
Implementation priorities: organise processes, integrate AI with ERP, and build intelligent benchmarks.
takeaways: Provide or enable secure, compliant environments (e.g., Digital Gateway) for AI workloads to protect sensitive tax data.
Ensure strict data governance and RODO-compliant handling as a precondition for AI in transfer pricing.
Support integration capabilities with ERP and benchmarking tools to enable AI-driven workflows and analyses.
Prioritise process standardisation and clear data pipelines before AI rollout to reduce operational risk.
Plan for upskilling and governance processes to manage AI outputs and mitigate hallucination risks.

items.title: Rynek dÃ³br luksusowych w obliczu transformacji | Andrzej Marczak, Tomasz WiÅ›niewski

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ The KPMG ON AIR episode discusses current forces reshaping the luxury goods market: a shift toward experiences over ownership, rising importance of ESG and certification, the emergence of "affordable luxury," and the role of personalization. Guests note that while global luxury demand softens, Poland's market continues to grow (though remains fragmented), with future drivers including AI, craftsmanship and luxury hospitality/tourism.
bullets: Global trends: "luxury fatigue," experiential focus, and "affordable luxury".
High concentration of value: top 2% of clients account for ~40% of the market.
Personalization, exclusive experiences, and Gen Z preference for experiences over possessions.
ESG and responsible luxury (e.g., eco-leathers, certifications) are increasingly important.
Poland: growing but fragmented market; luxury tourism, hotels, art and AI noted as future drivers.
takeaways: ESG emphasis in luxury suggests grid/data center operators should prioritize lowâ€‘carbon energy options and relevant certifications when courting premium/luxury-sector clients.
Growth in Polish luxury hospitality and premium tourism implies potential localized demand for reliable, highâ€‘quality power and connectivity in hotel, spa and event locations.
Discussion of AI and personalization as future trends indicates rising need for compute capacity, lowâ€‘latency services and scalable infrastructure to support dataâ€‘driven customer experiences.
Concentration of spending among a small wealthy segment points to demand profiles that value resilience, premium SLAs and bespoke service offerings rather than only volume-driven capacity.
